o: Control interface for Apache HTTP Server

o: A configuration instruction that controls behavior
Base directory for server configuration and logs

o: Directory from which files are served to clients

o: Primary hostname and port the server uses

q: ServerName helps Apache construct self-referential URLs.

o: Email address displayed in error messages

o: Sets the user account Apache runs as

o: Sets the group Apache runs as

o: Default file served when directory is requested

q: DirectoryIndex index.html index.php tries files in order.

o: Configures access logging with custom format

o: Includes files if they exist, no error if missing

o: Hosts multiple domains on single server

o: Virtual hosts distinguished by hostname in request

o: Access control for authentication and authorization

o: Module for URL rewriting with regex

q: mod_rewrite must be loaded to use RewriteRule.

o: Condition that must be met for RewriteRule to apply

q: RewriteCond precedes the ______ it applies to.

o: Last - stop processing rules if matched

q: [QSA] flag appends query string to substitution.

o: Enables SSL/TLS for a virtual host

q: SSLEngine on activates HTTPS for the virtual host.

o: Path to the server's public certificate

q: Header set adds or ______ a response header.
What is Header always set directive?
o: Sets header even on error responses

o: Module for gzip compression of responses

o: Module for controlling cache expiration headers

o: Sets default expiration for all content

o: Module for proxying and load balancing

q: mod_proxy enables Apache to act as reverse proxy.

o: Maps local paths to remote backends

o: Rewrites Location headers in proxy responses

q: ProxyPassReverse is essential for proper redirect handling.

bytraffic balances based on bytes transferred.

o: Routes to server with fewest active requests

o: Path to password file for user authentication

o: HTTP Digest authentication - more secure than Basic

q: Authorization containers allow complex access control logic.
